content: There may not be a significant difference between finding a solution before falling asleep or upon waking up, as both instances are part of the incubation period. During this period, your brain continues to work on the problem, even when you're not actively thinking about it. The idea is that by letting your mind relax and wander, it can make new connections and find solutions that you may not have thought of while actively working on the problem. So whether it's before falling asleep or upon waking up, your brain has had time to incubate and process the information, leading to potential solutions.
